Investment Comparison

The smart choice: upskilling vs. outsourcing

Traditional Approach

Local Marketing Agency

$ 2,500 - $4,000
per month

What You Get:

  • Monthly retainer commitment
  • 4-6 videos per month
  • Platform distribution
  • No internal capability building
  • Slow turnaround (3-5 days)
  • External dependency
Annual Cost: $30,000 - $48,000
Recommended Investment

Ashley's Upskilling Path

Time Allocation
2-4 hours per week initially

What You Get:

  • Unlimited videos per month
  • Same-day turnaround
  • Multi-platform optimization
  • Builds permanent internal capability
  • Deep brand understanding
  • Scales to website + AI automation
Additional Direct Cost: $0
Only time allocation within existing role

The Smart Investment

By allocating 2-4 hours per week for Ashley's professional development, you're not just saving $30,000-$48,000 annually in agency fees—you're building a compounding asset. Within 12 months, you'll have an in-house digital specialist who can handle video content, website management, and AI-powered automation. The agency delivers content. Ashley delivers transformation.

A Personal Note

Dear Will and Vivian,

Ashley is a vibrant, energetic, and highly capable information technology fresh grad. The opportunity you've given her to work in this environment will be life-changing for her.

How can we amplify that?

The first thing I'd say is to give her a solid two years of progression around technology. In that time, you'll have enormous value added to your business—well beyond the amount you pay for her services.

For her, this will open up many new doors and opportunities for her future. And, of course, if you decide to retain her into the future and we're able to meet market pricing for that skill set at that time, that is a potential outcome also.

The Win-Win:

Ashley's Win

She gets the steps and experience needed to have a fulfilling life and career

Your Win

You're getting an extremely valuable skill set inserted into your business without additional overhead

Happy to talk through it as much as you like.

Warmly,
Ben Carter
CEO, Yoonet
yoonet.io

Investing in people isn't just about filling positions—it's about creating futures and building capabilities that compound over time.
